title: 110_hr6535
content: The "Vietnam Education Foundation Amendments Act of 2008" establishes the Vietnam Education Foundation within the Department of State, replacing the Board of Directors with an Advisory Committee. The Vietnam Education Foundation Advisory Committee is established with 7 members appointed by various officials to provide advice on the Foundation's activities. The Advisory Committee of the Vietnam Education Foundation may include former members of the Foundation's Board of Directors. The Foundation is supervised by the Secretary and the Assistant Secretary for Educational and Cultural Affairs, in consultation with the Advisory Committee. Amendments are made to the Fellowship Program under the Act. Amendments are made to the Fellowship Program under the Act to prioritize individuals studying basic sciences for post-secondary education in the United States. Amendments to the Fellowship Program prioritize individuals studying basic sciences for post-secondary education in the United States. The Act is amended to redefine the term 'Secretary' and make conforming amendments to various sections. Amendments to the Mutual Educational and Cultural Exchange Act of 1961 include redefining the term 'Secretary' and transferring functions and assets of the Vietnam Education Foundation to the Bureau of Educational. The functions and assets of the Vietnam Education Foundation are transferred to the Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs of the Department of State. The Assistant Secretary for Educational and Cultural Affairs can hire former Foundation personnel and additional staff as needed. SEC. 3. AMERICAN RESEARCH COLLEGE IN VIETNAM. The Secretary of State can award grants to institutions of higher education to establish an American Research College in Vietnam for providing quality education to Vietnamese undergraduate students. Institutions must submit applications for the grant on a competitive basis. The Secretary of State can award grants on a competitive basis to establish an American Research College in Vietnam using funds from the Vietnam Education Foundation. The Government of Vietnam is encouraged to contribute financially to the college. The Act and its amendments will become effective 90 days after enactment.
